discussion.p: It appears there's an important guarantee missing from clause 22. We're told that invoking locale::global(L) sets the C locale if L has a name. However, we're not told whether or not invoking setlocale(s) sets the global C++ locale.
The intent, I think, is that it should not, but I can't find any such words anywhere.

resolution.p: Add a sentence at the end of , paragraph 2:

blockquote.p: No library function other than locale::global() shall affect the value returned by locale().
